result.execSummary:
The defendant Trisha Gayle Abbott-Mathews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both counts are Concurrent with one another, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Pay any restitution that is determined to be owed - State has 60 days to determine amount

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or course of education or a combination of both that equals full-time
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Follow the recommendations of the mental health assessment, including taking all prescribed medications as directed
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

The defendant is not to be present at any place where illicit drugs or controlled substances are present, found, used or trafficked
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

No sentence credit if revoked - credit has been used on other cases

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
On both counts concurrent (one-time only)
.
.
Concurrent with: Both counts are concurrent
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trisha Gayle Abbott-Mathews

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
